context: postoperative diagnoses: bilateral chronic otitis media

text: bilateral myringotomy with placement of pe tubes
context: name of operation: bilateral myringotomy with placement of pe tubes
the patient was taken to the operating room and placed in the supine position.
after adequate general inhalation anesthesia was obtained, the operating microscope with brought in for full use throughout the case.
an anterior-inferior radial incision was made in the left tympanic membrane.
the same procedure was repeated on the right side with similar findings noted of mucopurulent drainage.
a sheehy pressure equalization tube was placed in the myringotomy site.
